meanings.definition: A primer for teaching children to read, typically consisting of a sheet of parchment or paper protected by a sheet of transparent horn.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used hornbooks to help the kids learn to read.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, children learned to read using hornbooks.
meanings.sent3: The silly clown tried to read from a hornbook upside down!
meanings.sent4: Her love for reading was as clear as a hornbook in a library.
meanings.sent5: The hornbook glowed with knowledge, inviting the curious minds to explore.

meanings.definition: A basic manual or guide for beginners.
meanings.sent1: The new employee relied on the company's hornbooks to understand the procedures.
meanings.sent2: Before starting the project, she referred to the hornbooks for guidance.
meanings.sent3: The cat mistakenly sat on the hornbook, thinking it was a cushion!
meanings.sent4: His words were a hornbook for success, guiding others towards their goals.
meanings.sent5: The hornbook was a beacon of light in the sea of confusion, showing the way forward.
